content: count as a stitch 2 double_crochet in the first stitch 3 double_crochet in each stitch across the row 4 turn again you should have 16 double_crochet row 4 and up repeat row 2 and row 3 over and over o one row of crossed double_crochet o one row of plain double_crochet keep repeating these two row until your block is roughly square pg 19 www hodgepodge-crochet com finish fasten_off weave in all tails with a yarn needle so the block is neat and ready to join into the bag day 11 extended single_crochet square today s block is extended single_crochet esc it s like a single_crochet with a tiny extra step that makes it a bit taller and extra squishy to make 1 esc insert hook into stitch yarn over pull up a loop 2 loops on hook yarn over pull through 1 loop yarn over pull through both loops starting chain 17 row 1 esc in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across row 2+ chain 1 esc in each stitch across keep going in row of esc until your block is a square then fasten_off and weave in your ends what is an extended single_crochet esc you make 1 esc like this 1 insert hook into the stitch 2 yarn over pull up a loop you now have 2 loops on your hook 3 yarn over pull through just 1 loop on the hook o this makes a tiny chain and is the extended part 4 yarn over again pull through both loops on the hook o now you ve made 1 esc we ll use this same motion for every stitch in this block pattern block 11 extended single_crochet square starting chain 17 terms us crochet terms abbreviations chain chain esc extended single_crochet st s stitch es notes chain 1 at the start of a row does not count as a stitch all row in this block are extended single_crochet pg 20 www hodgepodge-crochet com you will have 16 stitches in every row use your main crochet hook for this pattern block instructions row 1 esc into the foundation chain 1 chain 17 2 work 1 esc in the 2nd chain from the hook o insert hook into 2nd chain o yarn over pull up a loop 2 loops on hook o yarn over pull through 1 loop o yarn over pull through both loops 3 work 1 esc in each remaining chain across the row in the same way 4 turn you should have 16 esc row 2 1 chain 1 does not count as a stitch 2 work 1 esc in the first stitch and then 1 esc in each stitch across the row 3 turn still 16 esc row 3 and all following row repeat row 2 o chain 1 o esc in first st and in each st across o turn keep going until your block is roughly square about as tall as it is wide end after a full esc
